description:
Join Martin Glover,  Deaf BSL user, architect and art facilitator, on a guided tour of The Line, East London's public art trail. Martin will lead you around the Greenwich Peninsula section of The Line, introducing you to installations by Alex Chinneck, Serge Attukwei Clottey & Antony Gormley & more.

The route is wheelchair-accessible and there will be only BSL interpretation, no spoken English.

events.name: BSL Guided Tour of The Line
events.notes: The walk is circular and will start and end at North Greenwich Station (O2 exit).

factsheet.heading: BSL Guided Tour of The Line
paragraphs: Join Martin Glover,  Deaf BSL user, architect and art facilitator, on a guided tour of The Line, East London's public art trail. Martin will lead you around the Greenwich Peninsula section of The Line, introducing you to installations by Alex Chinneck, Serge Attukwei Clottey & Antony Gormley & more.
The route is wheelchair-accessible and there will be only BSL interpretation, no spoken English.

factsheet.heading: About the Guide
paragraphs: Martin Glover is a Deaf BSL user, an architect and art facilitator. Across the UK, Martin delivers tours and workshops on contemporary art, architecture, street art, and public art/sculpture. He also manages his Digitspace project, championing better visual art access nationally.

location.address: North Greenwich Tube Station, 5 Millennium Way, SE10 0PH

name: BSL Walking Tour of The Line
